standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve linear equations in one variable.

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $  b  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3-2(b-2) &=  2-7b \\\\ 3-2b+4 &= 2-7b~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -2b+7 &= 2-7b~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ -2b+7\blueD{+7b} &= 2-7b\blueD{+7b} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 7b to each side}}\\\\ 5b+7 &=2 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 5b+7\blueD{-7} &=2 \blueD{-7} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 7 from each side}}\\\\  5b&=-5 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{5b}{\blueD{5}}&= \dfrac{-5}{\blueD{5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 5}} \\\\ b &= \greenD{-1} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ b   = \greenD{  -1 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  c  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4(3+c)+c &=  c+4 \\\\ 12+4c+c &= c+4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 5c+12 &= c+4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 5c+12\blueD{-c} &= c+4\blueD{-c} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract c from each side}}\\\\  4c+12&=4 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 4c+12\blueD{-12} &= 4\blueD{-12} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 12 from each side}}\\\\  4c&=-8 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{4c}{\blueD{4}}&= \dfrac{-8}{\blueD{4}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4 }} \\\\ c &= \greenD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$    c= \greenD{  -2 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  d  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2(5-d) &=  2-4d \\\\ 10-2d &= 2-4d~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -2d+10\blueD{+4d} &= 2-4d\blueD{+4d} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 4d to each side}}\\\\  2d+10&=2 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2d+10\blueD{-10} &= 2\blueD{-10} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 10 from each side}}\\\\ 2d &=-8 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2d}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{-8}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ d &= \greenD{-4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   d = \greenD{ -4  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ e   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 7(2e-1)-3 &=  6+6e \\\\ 14e-7 -3&= 6+6e~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 14e-10 &= 6+6e~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 14e-10\blueD{-6e} &= 6+6e\blueD{-6e} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 6e from each side}}\\\\  8e-10&=6 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 8e-10\blueD{+10} &=6 \blueD{+10} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 10 to each side}}\\\\ 8e &=16 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{8e}{\blueD{8}}&= \dfrac{16}{\blueD{8}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 8}} \\\\ e &= \greenD{2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$    e= \greenD{  2 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   f $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3(6-f)-4 &=  3f-4 \\\\ 18-3f -4&= 3f-4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 14-3f &= 3f-4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 14-3f\blueD{-3f} &= 3f-4\blueD{-3f} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 3f from each side}}\\\\ -6f+14 &=-4 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ -6f+14\blueD{-14} &= -4\blueD{-14} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 14 from each side}}\\\\ -6f &=-18 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-6f}{\blueD{-6}}&= \dfrac{-18}{\blueD{-6}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -6}} \\\\ f &= \greenD{3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   f = \greenD{  3 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  g  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 6(-2g-1) &=  -(13g+2) \\\\ -12g-6 &= -13g-2&&\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -12g-6\blueD{+12g} &= -13g\blueD{+12g} -2&&\small\gray{\text{Add 12g to each side}}\\\\ -6 \blueD{+2} &= -g-2\blueD{+2}&&\small\gray{\text{Add 2 to each side}}\\\\   {-4}&=-g &&\small\gray{\text{Divide by -1}}\\\\   \greenD{4}&=g &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  $    g= \greenD{4  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    h$ by itself.

$\begin{align} -(4+h) &=  3h \\\\ -4-h &= 3h&&\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -4-h\blueD{+h} &= 3h\blueD{+h}&&\small\gray{\text{Add h to each side}}\\\\ -4 &=4h &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-4}{\blueD{4}}&= \dfrac{4h}{\blueD{4}}&&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4}} \\\\ h &= \greenD{-1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  $  h  = \greenD{-1   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  h   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 7h &=  -(2h-18) \\\\ 7h &= -2h+18&&\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 7h\blueD{+2h} &= -2h+18\blueD{+2h} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 2h to each side}}\\\\ 9h &= 18&&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{9h}{\blueD{9}}&= \dfrac{18}{\blueD{9}}&&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 9}} \\\\ h &= \greenD{2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  $  h  = \greenD{  2 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  m   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} m &=  -(4+m)+2 \\\\ m &= -4-m+2&&\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ m &= -2-m&&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ m\blueD{+m} &= -2-m\blueD{+m} &&\small\gray{\text{Add m to each side}}\\\\ 2m&=-2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2m}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{-2}{\blueD{2}}&&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ m &= \greenD{-1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  $   m =\greenD{-1}~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    n $ by itself.

$\begin{align} -4n-8 &=  4(-3n+2) \\\\ -4n-8 &= -12n+8~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -4n-8\blueD{+12n} &= -12n+8\blueD{+12n} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 12n to each side}}\\\\  8n-8&=8 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 8n-8\blueD{+8} &= 8\blueD{+8} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 8 to each side}}\\\\  8n&= 16~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{8n}{\blueD{8}}&= \dfrac{16}{\blueD{8}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 8}} \\\\ n &= \greenD{2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ n   = 2\greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  p   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 10p-3 &=  2(12+4p)-7 \\\\ 10p-3 &= 24+8p-7~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 10p-3 &= 17+8p~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 10p-3\blueD{-8p} &= 17+8p\blueD{-8p} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 8p from each side}}\\\\  2p-3&=17 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2p-3\blueD{+3} &=17 \blueD{+3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 3 to each side}}\\\\ 2p&=20 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2p}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{20}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ p &= \greenD{10} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   p = 10\greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   r  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4r-3 &=  3(3r+4) \\\\ 4r-3 &= 9r+12~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 4r-3\blueD{-9r} &= 9r+12\blueD{-9r} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 9r from each side}}\\\\  -5r-3&=12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ -5r-3\blueD{+3} &=12 \blueD{+3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 3 to each side}}\\\\ -5r &= 15~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-5r}{\blueD{-5}}&= \dfrac{15}{\blueD{-5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -5}} \\\\ r &= \greenD{-3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   r =-3 \greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   s  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2s+4 &=  5(-4-2s) \\\\ 2s+4 &= -20-10s~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2s+4\blueD{+10s} &= -20-10s\blueD{+10s} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 10s to each side}}\\\\ 12s+4 &= -20~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 12s+4\blueD{-4} &= -20\blueD{-4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4 from each side}}\\\\ 12s &=-24 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{12s}{\blueD{12}}&= \dfrac{-24}{\blueD{12}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 12}} \\\\ s &= \greenD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   s =-2 \greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   t  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2-16t &=  6(-3t+2) \\\\ 2-16t &= -18t+12~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2-16t\blueD{+18t} &= -18t+12\blueD{+18t} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 18t to each side}}\\\\ 2+2t &=12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2+2t\blueD{-2} &= 12\blueD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side}}\\\\ 2t &=10 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2t}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{10}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ t &= \greenD{5} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  t  = 5\greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  f   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} -11f &=  7(1-2f)+5 \\\\ -11f &= 7-14f+5~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -11f &= 12-14f~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ -11f\blueD{+14f} &= 12-14f\blueD{+14f} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 14f to each side}}\\\\  3f&=12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{3f}{\blueD{3}}&= \dfrac{12}{\blueD{3}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 3}} \\\\ f &= \greenD{4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  f  =4 \greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $t$ by itself.

$\begin{align} -t &=  9(t-10) \\\\ -t &= 9t-90 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -t\blueD{-9t} &= 9t-90\blueD{-9t} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 9t from each side}}\\\\ -10t &=-90 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-10t}{\blueD{-10}}&= \dfrac{-90}{\blueD{-10}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -10}} \\\\ t &= \greenD{9} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$t = \greenD{9}~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  g   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 9g &=  3(-4+5g) \\\\ 9g &= -12+15g~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 9g\blueD{-15g} &= -12+15g\blueD{-15g} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 15g from each side}}\\\\ -6g &=-12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-6g}{\blueD{-6}}&= \dfrac{-12}{\blueD{-6}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -6}} \\\\ g &= \greenD{2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   g = 2\greenD{   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  k  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 8(10-k) &=  2k \\\\ 80-8k &= 2k~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 80-8k\blueD{+8k} &= 2k\blueD{+8k} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 8k to each side}}\\\\  80&= 10k~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{80}{\blueD{10}}&= \dfrac{10k}{\blueD{10}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 10}} \\\\ k &= \greenD{8} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$    k= \greenD{  8 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  m  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3-2(9+2m) &=  m \\\\ 3-18-4m &= m~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ -4m-15 &= m~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ -4m-15\blueD{+4m} &= m\blueD{+4m} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 4m to each side}}\\\\  -15&=5m ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-15}{\blueD{5}}&= \dfrac{5m}{\blueD{5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 5}} \\\\ m &= \greenD{-3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$   m = \greenD{-3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
